description: Python library for OpenADR
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
contribution_requirements_justification: It's described in the README.md file on GitHub: https://github.com/openleadr/openleadr-python#contributing
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/OpenLEADR/openleadr-python/blob/main/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Interim version are being worked on in their own branches.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: We have sematic versioning, done using git tags and accompanying releases to pypi.org
release_notes_justification: A changelog with release notes is part of our Project Status and Roadmap page of the docs: https://openleadr.org/docs/roadmap.html
release_notes_vulns_justification: There have not been any security vulnerabilities at this moment.
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: This is part of the README.md file on GitHub: https://github.com/openleadr/openleadr-python#security-issues
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: This is part of the README.md file on GitHub: https://github.com/openleadr/openleadr-python#security-issues
build_justification: Python software does not need to be built
test_justification: Users can run the included test suite in the repository by running pytest.
test_invocation_justification: We use pytest, the most used Python testing framework.
test_most_justification: We are now at > 83% code coverage.
test_policy_justification: We require any new code to be covered by tests before merging to a release: https://github.com/openleadr/openleadr-python#contributing
tests_are_added_justification: Code coverage reports can be generated for historic versions, which show that coverage only increases and never decreases over time.
tests_documented_added_justification: We require any new code to be covered by tests before merging to a release: https://github.com/openleadr/openleadr-python#contributing
warnings_justification: Code quality is supervised by flake8 in Github Actions
warnings_fixed_justification: We actively address DeprecationWarnings wherever possible, and won't allow other warnings apart of the warnings that we generate ourselves.
crypto_call_justification: We use the Python built-in HMAC and secrets libraries, as well as lxml's DSIG capabilities
crypto_keylength_justification: The project never generates keys on its own; it's up to the users of the software to generate secure keys. The acceptable security level of the keys is in part defined by the OpenADR standard.
crypto_password_storage_justification: No passwords are used in OpenLEADR
crypto_random_justification: We only use secure functions from openssl and the Python standard lib 'secrets' module for generating random numbers.
delivery_mitm_justification: The OpenADR communication makes use of HTTPS and message signing using XMLDSIG. The usage is detailed in the documentation: https://openleadr.org/docs/message_signing.html
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: We are commited to fixing critical vulnerabilities quickly, as stated in our project's README: https://github.com/openleadr/openleadr-python#security-issues
static_analysis_justification: We are using flake8, which are automatically run on GitHub Actions and can also be run locally.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Things that don't pass static code analysis don't get released, period.
dynamic_analysis_justification: We have an extensive test suite with more than 80% code coverage.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Automated tests are set up using Github Actions.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.

build_non_recursive_justification: The project is only a library/crate used by other Rust projects. It does not have its own build system.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The project is only a library/crate used by other Rust projects. As such it has no installable binaries.

name: Home Edge Project in LF Edge (edge-home-orchestration-go)
description: Home Edge Project, the seed codes will be contributed by Samsung Electronics, concentrates on driving and enabling a robust, reliable, and intelligent home edge computing open source framework, platform and ecosystem running on a variety of devices at daily home lives. To accelerate the deployment of the edge computing services ecosystem successfully, the Home Edge Project will provide users with an interoperable, flexible, and scalable edge computing services platform with a set of APIs that can also run with libraries and runtimes.
interact_justification:
1. https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go (Through a GitHub Issue reporting)
2. Slack channel: lfedge.slack.com (#homeedge)

license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/LICENSE>.

repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: We are operating RC (Release Candidate) versions before the regular release like our latest version called "Baobab". (https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/releases/tag/Baobab_rc1)

version_unique_justification: We support semantic versioning, but we also use alphabetical version for releases: "Alpha","Baobab","Coconut", and an upcoming release is D-release.
version_tags_justification:
Setup the dedicated branch and the proper tag from our official GitHub
Branch: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/tree/Baobab
Release package with a tag: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/releases/tag/baobab
release_notes_justification: Release notes for each release can be found https://wiki.lfedge.org/display/HOME/Roadmap+and+Release+Notes
release_notes_vulns_justification: We intend to do this, but until now we have not received security vulnerability reports.
report_tracker_justification:
We use the embedded issue tracker provided from GitHub.
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/issues
report_process_justification:
Overall guideline document from: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md
And following issue reporting template is provided from GitHub: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/tree/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE
report_responses_justification: 12 over 14 registered "open" issues are within 12 months (as of Oct. 29th, 2020, as of today)
enhancement_responses_justification: 11 over 14 registered "open" issues have responses from the community members within 12 months (as of Oct. 29th, 2020, as of today)
report_archive_justification: Provided by the embedded GitHub issue tracker: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed
vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
2 ways to report the vulnerability
1) embedded GitHub issue tab from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/issues
2) employed security vulnerability analysis from LGTM, described as a badge from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/README.md
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: "Our team will confirm your request within 1 week" from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/.github/SECURITY.md
build_floss_tools_justification: Using GitHub Action, which is for validating the build per each PR with FLOSS tools.
test_justification: Based on GitHub action, which is open source. Details: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/pull/138/files
test_invocation_justification: See item "2.2 Using standard Go language facilities" from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/docs/testing_policy.md#22-using-standard-go-language-facilities
test_most_justification: The main development is carried out in the master branch and tests cover the main functionality.
test_policy_justification: "When adding or changing functionality, the main requirement is to include new tests as part of your contribution" from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/docs/testing_policy.md#1-introduction
tests_are_added_justification: Each package is added with a suite of tests to verify that it works
tests_documented_added_justification: "When adding or changing functionality, the main requirement is to include new tests as part of your contribution" from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/docs/testing_policy.md#1-introduction
warnings_justification: The project uses a separate "linter" tools (golint, staticcheck) to look for code quality errors or common simple mistake.
warnings_fixed_justification: All found warnings from golint are fixed.
warnings_strict_justification: The project includes code verification using many utilities (Sonar, lint, vet, staticcheck) that provide a high level of detection of remarks.
know_secure_design_justification: Have a primary developer/contributor for security aspect. Taras Drozdovskyi t.drozdovsky@samsung.com
know_common_errors_justification:
See several his contributions about security.
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/issues/147
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/issues/149
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/issues/131
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/pull/96
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/pull/90
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/pull/86
crypto_published_justification: The project uses standard cryptographic protocols and algorithms: https, SSL/TLS, JWT, SHA256, RSA.
crypto_call_justification: The project uses standard cryptographic golang package "crypto" and "openssl" for CLI.
crypto_floss_justification: The whole project and all 3-rd party components are implemented using FLOSS.
crypto_keylength_justification: Key length for cryptographic operations follows the NIST recommendation (SHA: 256; AES:256: RSA:2048).
crypto_working_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms do not use legacy algorithms and protocols (no need to use them for compatibility).
crypto_pfs_justification: Key distribution system (PKI) has not yet been implemented. The key generation system will use randomization mechanisms to avoid the possibility of compromising keys if a long-term key is lost.
crypto_password_storage_justification: User authentication is done using tokens issued by a 3rd party. When the user registration function is implemented, the password will be stored in a hashed form using the iterated algorithm (PBKDF2).
crypto_random_justification: For generate all cryptographic keys and nonces using a generator from crypto library (openssl).
delivery_mitm_justification: The project use https delivery mechanism.
delivery_unsigned_justification: Digital signature of the message is used for external interfaces.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: Vulnerabilities of medium and high severity are eliminated as soon as possible.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: The project uses the LGTM system to detect vulnerabilities.
static_analysis_justification: The edge-home-orchestration-go uses SonarCloud for static analysis. https://sonarcloud.io/organizations/lf-edge/projects
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Critical and important warnings are corrected immediately, the project team strives to correct all possible warnings.
static_analysis_often_justification: SonarCloud is configured to perform analysis on every PR and Push.
dynamic_analysis_justification: We use SonarCloud, CodeQL Analysis, golint and govet as a stopgap. And are interested in implementing the above as it becomes available for Go.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We use SonarCloud, CodeQL Analysis, golint, govet and Staticcheck as a stopgap. And are interested in implementing the above as it becomes available for Go.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: The security of Edge Orchestration project is the main goal of our team and we try to fix vulnerabilities as soon as possible. We will stick with this after adding a dynamic analyzer when it becomes available.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: Security mechanisms that used in the project are independent of algorithms with known severe vulnerabilities.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Enabled by GitHub Action: so the automated build test is done per every PR submission.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: The project contains instructions for generating private credential, and does not contain sensitive data in the repository.
english_justification: All the documents are provided in English from GitHub and Wiki. Plus, we are dealing with all the bug reports and comments from GitHub system in English as well.
hardening_justification:
The features of the Go language, as well as the use of the compiler settings, have given the opportunity to get the following results after analysis by the hardering-check program.

$ hardening-check edge-orchestration
edge-orchestration:
 Position Independent Executable: no, normal executable!
 Stack protected: yes
 Fortify Source functions: yes

Also in the future, we plan to use HTTP headers like Content Security Policy.
crypto_used_network_justification: SSHv2 and TLS 1.2 are used in the project. Normal (unsecure) mode (using http) is for beginner-level development and testing only.
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: In secure mode, the TLS certificate is checked by default
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: In secure mode, the TLS certificate is checked by default
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
installation_common_justification: The product is a docker image, hence the installation is done in a standard way for docker.
dco_justification: The use of the contribution signature is documented in the contribution rules https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#8-commit-your-changes and is also checked at each PR.
access_continuity_justification:
There is no secret or similar owned by any single individual that risks hurting the project in case absent for a lot of time. We officially list up the delegates not as an individual, but a team rosters and this information is accessible in public with the proper email thread and documents in Wiki. More on that, we have a dedicate operator supported from Linux Foundation Edge team, who properly channel and handle any community items to be resolved in time.

https://wiki.lfedge.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1671336
https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go#quick-start-guides-for-supported-platforms
bus_factor_justification: We're having everything extensively documented and tested. There are no secrets. Referring to the different forms (one of: https://www.process.st/bus-factor/#how ) of calculating "bus factor" can be said with certainty that it is not less than 2.
documentation_current_justification: We constantly monitor all changes in the project and try to immediately adapt the documentation.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: The web site and documentation are plain text-based and don't require complexly UI things.
internationalization_justification: This software is intended for IT-professionals for whom knowledge of the English language is not a problem.
sites_password_security_justification: The project doesn't store any passwords.
maintenance_or_update_justification: Project always backwards compatible at all times.
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: We have completed to resolve all the detected vulnerability from CodeQL and LGTM services and in the last 12 months, there have been no vulnerabilities resolved as of September 3rd, 2021.
coding_standards_justification: The project uses standard formatting for the Go language. It is also recommended for the user to run `make fmt` command that automatically fixes coding style errors. https://golang.org/doc/effective_go
coding_standards_enforced_justification: For each PR, the CI runs a coding style check (utilities are used: gofmt, vet, golint, staticcheck)
build_standard_variables_justification: We honor the relevant compiler and linker variables in our build script in https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/Makefile.
build_non_recursive_justification: This is clearly configured in our build script in https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/Makefile.
build_repeatable_justification: During the build, the date and time of its creation are included in the binary file. Hence the binary file will be different.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The docker container can be launched from anywhere, and the configuration has a fixed location, since it is access control sensitive.
installation_development_quick_justifica: Quick start guidance from: (with and without build option on various target platforms) https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/README.md
external_dependencies_justification: All dependencies are listed in the go.mod https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/go.mod
dependency_monitoring_justification: We monitor dependency updates carefully and update them as needed. (Ex. https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/pull/357 )
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Using the `go mod` utility we can easily track external dependencies.
interfaces_current_justification: We try to use new versions of components and that they comply with the FLOSS (Ex. https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/pull/357 )
automated_integration_testing_justificat: The test suite is run for each PR https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/actions/workflows/test-suite.yml
test_statement_coverage80_justification: Due to the multi-platform nature of project, it is very hard to reach. We're at 73.73% Total Coverage
test_policy_mandated_justification: "When adding or changing functionality, the main requirement is to include new tests as part of your contribution" from https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/docs/testing_policy.md#1-introduction
implement_secure_design_justification: We have a strong focus on open secure design principles
input_validation_justification: A critical incoming parameter is a launched container, to control it there is a white list of containers (the key is a container hash). Only admin can to modify this white list.
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: The project uses standard crypto-components that support a large number of algorithms.
crypto_credential_agility_justification: Authentication data and private keys that are generated during operation are stored separately from configuration files, logs and databases.
signed_releases_justification:
All our 5 releases are signed releases. And meets the OpenSSF ScoreCard project requirement.

Updated status of ScoreCard:
|---------|------------------------|--------------------------------|
| 7 / 10  | CII-Best-Practices    | badge detected: silver       |

|----------|------------------------|-------------------------------------|
| 10 / 10 | Signed-Releases     | 5 out of 5 artifacts are             |
|            |                              | signed -- score normalized to  |
|            |                              | 10                                          |
version_tags_signed_justification: All tags in the project are signed. https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/tags
copyright_per_file_justification: Each source file has the copyright statement as described like : https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/internal/common/commandvalidator/commandvalidator.go
license_per_file_justification: Each source file has the Apache 2.0 license statement as described like: https://github.com/lf-edge/edge-home-orchestration-go/blob/master/internal/common/commandvalidator/commandvalidator.go
